item.description:
July 23, 2008

To all of our terrific, talented members -

Time for a vacation!

In Paris, once the world's center of graphic design,
it is -- as I think they say -- comme il faut
to take the month of August off as vacation time.

That diversion is, I confess, mere pretext:
your interim temporary organizer has gotten
himself so completely over-committed with
and enmeshed in various vast and overwhelming
projects that he can think of nothing else
at the moment but digging himself out from
under various massive tasks under which he
has recently buried himself.

But you are all splendidly talented, articulate,
engaging designers -- so, as one of the old
Saturday Night Live characters used to say:
"Talk among yourselves!"

Your interim temporary organizer hopes
to have unburied himself (at least to a degree)
by Labor Day.

Let's meet again on Monday, September 15th, at 7:30 pm,
at the Trident.

Keep up your terrific and valiant work --
and have a great summer!


Lee





Parking can be difficult but not impossible to find on Newbury Street.
If you are coming in from outside the city,
I recommend parking a bit farther out and taking
the Green Line B, C, or D routes to the Hynes Convention
Center stop, that's just half a block from the Trident.


For more information, see http://www.tridentboo...


But we may well change over to a location that offers far better immediate parking opportunities.
Davis Square in Somerville is a real possibility. The Diesel Cafe there has a large back room
that we might be able to use.
